description.en:
This test helps identify your dominant motivational pattern ‚Äî what drives your actions, decisions, and reactions to life situations. Based on the theory of basic psychological needs and modern motivation research, the test reveals 9 core strategies that people use to achieve satisfaction and overcome life challenges.

Understanding your motivational strategy will help you better recognize your strengths, growth areas, and optimal paths for self-realization. The test also shows your secondary motivation type, providing a more complete picture of your personality.

test_info.author: Based on Self-Determination Theory (Deci & Ryan) and Motivational Systems Theory

en: Defense Strategies and Coping Mechanisms Theory

target_audience.en: Adults 18+, interested in self-knowledge and personal development

core_motivation.en: To be right, honest, and improve the world around

short_description.en: Need to be needed and care for others

core_motivation.en: To be loved through caring and helping others
To achieve goals and receive recognition for success
To be special and express authenticity
To understand the world and possess competence
To feel safe and have reliable support

short_description.en: Pursuit of joy and new possibilities

core_motivation.en: To be happy and avoid pain through new experiences
To be strong and protect oneself and others

short_description.en: Striving for peace and inner calm

core_motivation.en: To maintain harmony and avoid conflicts

text.en: It's important for me to do everything correctly, even in small details
I feel satisfied when I help others solve their problems
Achieving visible results motivates me the most
I often feel that I differ from most people in my perception of the world
I need to deeply understand an issue before making a decision
I prefer to have a clear plan and know what lies ahead
I'm always looking for new experiences and opportunities for fun
I'm not afraid to confront others when I'm sure I'm right
I prefer to avoid conflicts and maintain a calm atmosphere
It upsets me when people act unethically or unfairly
I often forget about my own needs while caring for others
Recognition of my achievements by others is very important to me
I deeply experience my emotions and often reflect
I prefer to observe and analyze rather than act immediately
Uncertainty causes me anxiety
I have difficulty tolerating boredom and monotony
I value strength and self-confidence more than gentleness
I easily adapt to others' opinions to avoid creating tension
I strive for self-improvement and working on my flaws
It's hard for me to ask for help, I'm used to helping others
I always set ambitious goals for myself
I'm attracted to everything unusual and artistic
I prefer to minimize social contacts to focus on my interests
I value reliability and consistency in people
I prefer to keep several options open rather than focus on one
I naturally take on the role of leader in a group
It's easier for me to agree with others than to defend my position
I often criticize myself for mistakes and imperfections
I feel valuable when others need me
I adapt my behavior depending on the situation to achieve success
I often feel that something is missing in my life
I need time alone to restore my energy
I often doubt my decisions and seek additional confirmation
I find ways to make even routine tasks interesting
I defend the weak and unfairly offended
I tend to postpone making decisions to maintain peace
I have clear ideas about what is right and what is wrong
I intuitively sense the emotional needs of others
Failure is perceived by me painfully and lowers my self-esteem
I appreciate beauty and aesthetics in all manifestations of life
I collect information and knowledge, even if I don't plan to use them
I am loyal to people and organizations that have earned my trust
I am impatient and want to try everything right now
I speak directly and don't hide my opinion
It's difficult for me to say 'no', even when it's in my best interest
I believe there's always a better way to do something
I get energy from the opportunity to care for loved ones
I focus on results more than on the process
I like to express myself through creativity or unique style
I feel comfortable in the role of expert or specialist
I carefully assess risks before making decisions
I focus on positive possibilities rather than limitations
I respect strength and can show toughness when necessary
I value comfort and stability more than ambition
I notice mistakes and flaws where others don't see them
I tend to take pride in myself through the success of those I've helped
I define my worth through achievements and successes
I feel a strong pull toward what seems unattainable or lost
I prefer to think about a problem rather than act emotionally immediately
I seek guidance and support from authority figures
It's hard for me to focus on one task when there's so much interesting around
I'm not afraid of confrontation and can show aggression to protect my interests
I can lose touch with my true desires by adapting to others
I experience inner tension from awareness of the world's imperfection
I manipulate situations so that others need me
I'm afraid of looking like a failure in others' eyes
I tend to idealize what I don't have
I can detach from emotions to maintain clarity of thinking
I project my fears onto the external world, seeing dangers everywhere
I avoid negative emotions by switching to something pleasant
I can be overly controlling and dominating
I tend toward passivity and procrastination on important matters
I demand high standards from myself and others
I suppress my own needs for the sake of others
I put work and achievements above relationships
I can become overly absorbed in my emotional experiences
I minimize contact with the outside world, feeling drained by people
I experience constant anxiety about the future
I impulsively make decisions to avoid discomfort
I hide my vulnerability behind a mask of strength
I forget about my priorities, dissolving in the flow of life
I experience righteous anger when confronted with injustice
It's hard for me to accept help, I'm used to giving, not receiving
I strive to be the best at what I do
I feel misunderstood by most people
I explore topics deeper than necessary for practical purposes
I feel more comfortable in a structured and predictable environment
I see life as an adventure full of possibilities
I prefer to control the situation rather than be controlled
I value peace and harmony above all else

core_motivation.en: To be right, honest, and improve oneself and the world

description.en:
You are driven by a deep desire for perfection and correctness. Your life is a constant process of self-improvement and making the world around you better. You possess a strong internal compass of ethics and morality that guides all your actions. You notice inconsistencies and errors where others don't see them, and feel responsible for correcting them.

Your inner critic can be very demanding, constantly making you evaluate yourself and your actions. You believe there's always a 'right' way to do things and strive to find it. Your discipline, honesty, and commitment to principles make you a reliable and respected person.

en: High standards for self and others
Strong sense of right and wrong
Ability to see and correct errors
Learn to see 'good enough' as acceptable
Acknowledge your anger and express it constructively

core_motivation.en: To be loved and needed through caring for others

description.en:
You are relationship-oriented and deeply motivated by the desire to be helpful and loved. Your empathy and ability to sense others' needs make you an indispensable friend and helper. You gain satisfaction from helping people solve their problems and often put others' needs above your own.

Your generosity and warmth create an atmosphere of care and support around you. You intuitively understand what others need, sometimes even before they do. However, it's important for you to remember your own needs and not dissolve completely in caring for others.

en: Learn to recognize and express your needs
Recognize your worth independent of helping others

core_motivation.en: To achieve success and receive recognition for accomplishments

description.en:
You are results-oriented and motivated by achieving visible success. Your energy, determination, and ability to adapt help you effectively reach your goals. You know how to make an impression and present yourself in the best light, making you successful in career and social situations.

You measure your worth through achievements and others' recognition. Your productivity and multitasking ability impress those around you. However, it's important to remember that your true worth doesn't depend only on external success.

core_motivation.en: To be unique and express authenticity

description.en:
You are deeply emotional and motivated by seeking uniqueness and meaning. Your capacity for deep reflection and emotional sensitivity allow you to create something truly original. You value beauty, authenticity, and depth in all aspects of life.

You often feel different from others, and this particularity can be both a source of inspiration and loneliness. Your rich inner life and ability for creative self-expression make you unique. However, it's important not to idealize what you don't have and value what you do.

en: Balance between inner world and external reality

core_motivation.en: To understand the world and possess competence

description.en:
You are intellectually curious and motivated by deep understanding. Your analytical ability and knowledge accumulation make you an expert in chosen fields. You value independence, solitude, and time for reflection.

You prefer to observe and analyze before acting. Your need for understanding and competence drives your constant pursuit of knowledge. You can detach from emotions to maintain mental clarity, but it's also important to stay connected with the world and people.

en: Balance between reflection and life participation

core_motivation.en: To feel safe and have reliable support

description.en:
You are motivated by the need for security and reliability. Your loyalty, responsibility, and ability to foresee problems make you a reliable partner and team member. You value structure, consistency, and trust.

You carefully assess risks and thoroughly plan for the future. Your loyalty to people and organizations that have earned your trust is unwavering. You may experience anxiety about uncertainty, but this vigilance also helps you and others avoid dangers.

core_motivation.en: To be happy and avoid pain through new experiences

description.en:
You are motivated by the pursuit of joy, freedom, and novelty. Your enthusiasm, optimism, and ability to see possibilities make you a source of inspiration for others. You seek variety and adventure in all areas of life.

You focus on positive future possibilities and avoid negative emotions by switching to something pleasant. Your ability to find joy and make the ordinary interesting is valued by others. However, it's also important to learn to deal with difficulties rather than just avoid them.

en: Self-destructive behavior behind mask of fun

core_motivation.en: To be strong and protect oneself and others

description.en:
You are motivated by strength, control, and justice. Your confidence, decisiveness, and ability to take responsibility make you a natural leader. You're not afraid of conflicts and ready to defend the weak and uphold justice.

You value directness, honesty, and strength, both in yourself and others. Your energy and capacity for action are impressive. You control situations to protect yourself and those who depend on you. However, it's also important to acknowledge your vulnerability and not hide it behind a mask of strength.

core_motivation.en: To maintain harmony and avoid conflicts

description.en:
You are motivated by maintaining peace, harmony, and inner calm. Your ability to see different perspectives and create an atmosphere of acceptance makes you an excellent mediator. You value stability, comfort, and absence of tension.

You easily adapt to others' opinions and prefer to avoid conflicts. Your calmness and acceptance create a safe space for those around you. However, it's also important not to forget your own desires and priorities, not dissolving completely in the flow of life.

copyright_notice.en: This test is an original development based on scientific motivation theories. The test does not copy protected methodologies and is created for educational purposes.
